meanings.definition: The state of a nerve or muscle in response to an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The electrotonus of the nerve changed when the electric current passed through.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the electrotonus of muscles to understand their response to electricity.
meanings.sent3: The nerve's electrotonus was like a dance party with the electric current as the DJ.
meanings.sent4: Her muscles' electrotonus was a symphony of responses to the electric current.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of electrotonus made it easier to grasp the concept.

meanings.definition: The process of electrical conduction in nerve fibers.
meanings.sent1: Understanding electrotonus helps in studying how nerve fibers conduct electricity.
meanings.sent2: The electrotonus of nerve fibers is crucial for proper communication in the body.
meanings.sent3: The nerve fibers' electrotonus was like a relay race passing on the electric signal.
meanings.sent4: The electrotonus of nerve fibers resembled a busy highway with electrical signals as cars.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the electrotonus of nerve fibers made it easier to remember.

meanings.definition: The alteration in excitability of a nerve or muscle due to an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The electrotonus caused a change in the nerve's excitability when the current flowed.
meanings.sent2: Doctors observed the electrotonus to see how the nerve's excitability was affected.
meanings.sent3: The nerve's excitability went on a rollercoaster ride with the electrotonus.
meanings.sent4: Her muscle's excitability was a rollercoaster of responses to the electrotonus.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of electrotonus made the concept more memorable.
